title: Augmented Reality-Based Scientific Inquiry of Reinforced Concrete Structures: Collaborative Learning Through Hypothesis Verification of Reinforcement Placement

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental concrete engineering and 2D drafting with rebar notation comprehension, basic grasp of the scientific inquiry method (hypothesis-experiment-observation-conclusion), and experience using measurement tools
context.additional_context: Conduct collaborative learning in mixed reality environments using HoloLens 2 and tablet PCs. Simultaneously enhance engineering problem-solving and scientific inquiry skills through experimental design, evidence collection, and data analysis processes.

learning_goals: Using 3D augmented reality models, learners can accurately identify, measure, and verify hypotheses about rebar positioning, spacing, and binding methods through scientific observation.
Through collaborative activities, learners can convert complex rebar layout diagrams into 3D spatial information, control key variables, and systematically analyze experimental data.
In an AR environment, learners can detect and correct rebar binding errors with over 90% accuracy, derive scientific conclusions based on experimental results, and present evidence.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
